intro: Spergula heterosperma, commonly known as the variable sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and similar plants. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, meadows, and along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to brownish flowers. Its seeds are characterized by their variable shape and size, which contribute to its common name.
